item.title: Frappe Insights – Query Loading Extremely Slow and Timing Out
item.dc:creator: Uthara
item.description:
Hello,

I am experiencing a major loading issue in Frappe Insights. The queries are taking a very long time to fetch data, and eventually they time out. I have already enabled the Data Store option in both Query Builders, but the issue still persists.

The table contains approximately 2.5 lakh (250,000) rows, and while loading the result set, Insights shows a loading spinner for a long time and then displays a timeout error.

I have attached a screenshot for reference.
Kindly look into this issue and advise how it can be resolved.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Frappe Insights – Query Loading Extremely Slow and Timing Out

item.title: i want to create a query that logged user base access data in insight frappe
item.dc:creator: jithukrishna
item.description:
I am currently using the following SQL query in my Frappe Insight dashboard to display data based on the logged-in user:

SELECT
    ed.name AS enquiry_id,
    ed.team_lead,
    COUNT(DISTINCT tl.name) AS total_enquiry,
    SUM(CASE WHEN DATE(ed.next_follow_up_date) = CURDATE() THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS today_followup,
    SUM(CASE WHEN tl.status = 'Hot' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS hot_leads,
    SUM(CASE WHEN tl.status = 'Warm' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS warm_leads,
    SUM(CASE WHEN tl.status = 'Cold' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS cold_leads,
    tl.user_id AS team_lead_user,
    tl.designation AS team_lead_designation,
    ed.employee_name AS kec_name,
    kec_emp.first_name AS kec_user,
    kec_emp.designation AS kec_designation
FROM `tabEnquiry Detail` ed
JOIN `tabEmployee` tl ON tl.name = ed.team_lead
LEFT JOIN `tabEmployee` kec_emp ON kec_emp.name = ed.employee_name
WHERE tl.user_id = '{{ frappe.session.user }}'
ORDER BY ed.name;

However, this query is not fetching data for the logged-in user. The reason is that in Frappe Insights v3+, the variable {{ frappe.session.user }} is no longer supported in SQL queries. As a result, the filter condition does not correctly resolve to the current user, and the query returns no results.

how can i fix that ?

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: i want to create a query that logged user base access data in insight frappe

item.title: Website works on mobile but not desktop
item.dc:creator: Sreekufegno
item.description:
Hi everyone,

I recently moved my website to Cloudflare (about 18 hours ago) and updated the nameservers. Everything was working great at first — the site was faster and loading fine — but now it only works on mobile, not on desktop.

On desktop it says “This page isn’t working / too many redirects.”

I’ve cleared cache and tried different browsers but still getting the same issue. Any ideas what could be causing this or how to fix it?

The website is for Granitogres, a Porcelain & Ceramic Tile Manufacturer & Exporter in India, so uptime is really important for our clients.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Website works on mobile but not desktop

item.title: How to Filter Insights Dashboards by Logged-In User’s Department
item.dc:creator: Amal-H-Prasad
item.description:
Hi everyone,

I’m working on a Frappe Insights setup and need help implementing role- and department-based filtering for Number Cards.

Use Case:

I have multiple departments like:

  • Housekeeping
  • IT
  • Maintenance

For each department, I’ve created separate Number Cards in Insights, such as:

  • Housekeeping Tickets
  • IT Tickets
  • Maintenance Tickets

The goal is:
When a supervisor logs in, they should only see the number cards relevant to their department.

Example:

  • If a user belongs to the Housekeeping department they should only see Housekeeping Open Tickets.
    If a user belongs to the Maintenance department they should only see Maintenance Open Tickets.
  • Admins or managers should see all departments.

Current Challenge:

  • Right now, all users can see all the Number Cards, regardless of their department.
  • I need a way to filter dashboards automatically based on the logged-in user’s department, without manually creating separate dashboards for each user.

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: How to Filter Insights Dashboards by Logged-In User’s Department

how can i view it fully?

item.title: Individual filters on each chart
item.dc:creator: Stark
item.description:
Hi everyone,
I’m working on a dashboard in both ERPNext and Insights. I already have multiple charts like total sales, new customers registered, etc., and they all display correctly.

Now, I do not want a global date filter for the entire dashboard.
Instead, I want to add individual date filters on each chart so that users can filter each chart separately based on its own date range.

That way, I can compare different timeframes in different charts (e.g., Sales in Q1 vs. Customers in Q2), all within the same dashboard.

Is this possible in Frappe Insights Dashboards?
How can I add independent filters on each chart block?

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Individual filters on each chart

item.title: Local installation issue
item.dc:creator: EduRoman
item.description:

ubuntu 22.04 LTS
bench-frappe@vps-c6c53df8:~/bench-frappe/sites$ bench version
erpnext 15.70.2
frappe 15.74.1
payments 0.0.1

item.title: Frappe Insights - Dynamic Queries?
item.dc:creator: Ramki_Marichamy
item.description:
Hi all,

I’m currently exploring Frappe Insights.

As an admin, I’m able to create workbooks and charts that use queries to visualize all data in the system — which works as expected.

Now, I’d like to restrict data visibility based on the logged-in user. Specifically:

  • If I share a workbook with a specific user (non-admin),
  • That user should only see data related to their own account, not the entire dataset.

Is this possible in Frappe Insights?

If yes:

  • How can I dynamically filter the query results in the workbook based on the logged-in user?
  • Is there a built-in placeholder like {{ user }} or a recommended way to access frappe.session.user in Insights queries?
  • Any best practices for building multi-user dashboards in a secure way?

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Frappe Insights - Dynamic Queries?

item.title: Insights frappe.session.user cache problems
item.dc:creator: dellui
item.description:
I’m creating a dashboard to present opportunities with Frappe Insights: v3.2.4 (HEAD). I want to display the various graphs filtering by the current user. I used a query script and thought I had solved it. However, I’m having big problems with session isolation per user. If I connect with user X, I get the data for X correctly, but if I disconnect and reconnect with user Y, I continue to see the data for user X. If I clear the cache, for example with frappe.cache().delete_keys(“insights:*”) and press F5, I see the data for Y correctly. This thing seems really strange to me. Can anyone help me?

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Insights frappe.session.user cache problems
